column1: '''Firienfeld''' was how the [[Rohirrim]] called the flat upland of [[Dunharrow]]; a large grassy area for the encampment of soldiers and refuge-seekers.<ref>{{RK
column2: V3}}</ref>  [[Aragorn]] and the [[Grey Company]] passed through the Firienfeld on [[8 March]] {{TA
column3: 3019}}; King [[Th√©oden]] and his riders arrived there the next day.<ref>{{App

column1: Firien represents [[Old English]] ''firgen'', "mountain"; ''-feld,'' means "field" and [[J.R.R. Tolkien
column2: Tolkien]] left it unmodernised; the Firienfield of the Index is in error.<ref>{{HM
